function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of focus on disease propagation in the built environment","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread and public health crises","Mitigation":"Incorporating health-focused design principles and certifications into urban planning and architecture","Technologies":"Health-oriented building certifications, community design focused on disease prevention","People":"Residents, workers, visitors in urban environments","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, building developers"},{"Description":"Inadequate ventilation and indoor air quality in buildings","Impact":"Higher risk of airborne disease transmission and respiratory health issues","Mitigation":"Improved ventilation systems, air purification technologies, and adherence to health-oriented building certifications","Technologies":"HEPA filters, UV sterilization, natural ventilation systems","People":"Occupants of buildings and indoor spaces","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, architects"},{"Description":"Lack of focus on mixed-use zoning and community design for disease prevention","Impact":"Limited opportunities for physical activity, social interaction, and self-containment, leading to higher disease transmission risk","Mitigation":"Promotion of mixed-use zoning, walkable neighborhoods, and community design that encourages physical activity and social interaction","Technologies":"Urban planning tools, smart city technology, pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure","People":"Residents, workers, visitors in urban environments","Owner":"City planners, urban designers, community stakeholders"}]}
